label: 公験
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: proof documents for land holdings, typically evidencing the origins and tax status of the land, including stipulations for tax exemption or other special circumstances. Alternatively, the term denoted certifying papers held by a monk that indicated government permission for his monastic (and tax-exempt) status.
